20#ifndef _DEV_ATH_DESC_H
21#define _DEV_ATH_DESC_H
22
23#include "opt_ah.h" /* NB: required for AH_SUPPORT_AR5416 */
24
25/*
26 * Transmit descriptor status. This structure is filled
27 * in only after the tx descriptor process method finds a
28 * ``done'' descriptor; at which point it returns something
29 * other than HAL_EINPROGRESS.
30 *
31 * Note that ts_antenna may not be valid for all h/w. It
32 * should be used only if non-zero.
33 */
34struct ath_tx_status {
35 uint16_t ts_seqnum; /* h/w assigned sequence number */
36 uint16_t ts_tstamp; /* h/w assigned timestamp */
37 uint8_t ts_status; /* frame status, 0 => xmit ok */
38 uint8_t ts_rate; /* h/w transmit rate index */
39#define HAL_TXSTAT_ALTRATE 0x80 /* alternate xmit rate used */
40 int8_t ts_rssi; /* tx ack RSSI */
41 uint8_t ts_shortretry; /* # short retries */
42 uint8_t ts_longretry; /* # long retries */
43 uint8_t ts_virtcol; /* virtual collision count */
44 uint8_t ts_antenna; /* antenna information */
45 uint8_t ts_finaltsi; /* final transmit series index */
46#ifdef AH_SUPPORT_AR5416
47 /* 802.11n status */
48 uint8_t ts_flags; /* misc flags */
49 int8_t ts_rssi_ctl[3]; /* tx ack RSSI [ctl, chain 0-2] */
50 int8_t ts_rssi_ext[3]; /* tx ack RSSI [ext, chain 0-2] */
51/* #define ts_rssi ts_rssi_combined */
52 uint32_t ts_ba_low; /* blockack bitmap low */
53 uint32_t ts_ba_high; /* blockack bitmap high */
54 uint32_t ts_evm0; /* evm bytes */
55 uint32_t ts_evm1;
56 uint32_t ts_evm2;
57#endif /* AH_SUPPORT_AR5416 */
58};
59
60/* bits found in ts_status */
61#define HAL_TXERR_XRETRY 0x01 /* excessive retries */
62#define HAL_TXERR_FILT 0x02 /* blocked by tx filtering */
63#define HAL_TXERR_FIFO 0x04 /* fifo underrun */
64#define HAL_TXERR_XTXOP 0x08 /* txop exceeded */
65#define HAL_TXERR_TIMER_EXPIRED 0x10 /* Tx timer expired */
66
67/* bits found in ts_flags */
68#define HAL_TX_BA 0x01 /* Block Ack seen */
69#define HAL_TX_AGGR 0x02 /* Aggregate */
70#define HAL_TX_DESC_CFG_ERR 0x10 /* Error in 20/40 desc config */
71#define HAL_TX_DATA_UNDERRUN 0x20 /* Tx buffer underrun */
72#define HAL_TX_DELIM_UNDERRUN 0x40 /* Tx delimiter underrun */
73
74/*
75 * Receive descriptor status. This structure is filled
76 * in only after the rx descriptor process method finds a
77 * ``done'' descriptor; at which point it returns something
78 * other than HAL_EINPROGRESS.
79 *
80 * If rx_status is zero, then the frame was received ok;
81 * otherwise the error information is indicated and rs_phyerr
82 * contains a phy error code if HAL_RXERR_PHY is set. In general
83 * the frame contents is undefined when an error occurred thought
84 * for some errors (e.g. a decryption error), it may be meaningful.
85 *
86 * Note that the receive timestamp is expanded using the TSF to
87 * at least 15 bits (regardless of what the h/w provides directly).
88 * Newer hardware supports a full 32-bits; use HAL_CAP_32TSTAMP to
89 * find out if the hardware is capable.
90 *
91 * rx_rssi is in units of dbm above the noise floor. This value
92 * is measured during the preamble and PLCP; i.e. with the initial
93 * 4us of detection. The noise floor is typically a consistent
94 * -96dBm absolute power in a 20MHz channel.
95 */
96struct ath_rx_status {
97 uint16_t rs_datalen; /* rx frame length */
98 uint8_t rs_status; /* rx status, 0 => recv ok */
99 uint8_t rs_phyerr; /* phy error code */
100 int8_t rs_rssi; /* rx frame RSSI (combined for 11n) */
101 uint8_t rs_keyix; /* key cache index */
102 uint8_t rs_rate; /* h/w receive rate index */
103 uint8_t rs_more; /* more descriptors follow */
104 uint32_t rs_tstamp; /* h/w assigned timestamp */
105 uint32_t rs_antenna; /* antenna information */
106#ifdef AH_SUPPORT_AR5416
107 /* 802.11n status */
108 int8_t rs_rssi_ctl[3]; /* rx frame RSSI [ctl, chain 0-2] */
109 int8_t rs_rssi_ext[3]; /* rx frame RSSI [ext, chain 0-2] */
110 uint8_t rs_isaggr; /* is part of the aggregate */
111 uint8_t rs_moreaggr; /* more frames in aggr to follow */
112 uint8_t rs_num_delims; /* number of delims in aggr */
113 uint8_t rs_flags; /* misc flags */
114 uint32_t rs_evm0; /* evm bytes */
115 uint32_t rs_evm1;
116 uint32_t rs_evm2;
117#endif /* AH_SUPPORT_AR5416 */
118};
119
120/* bits found in rs_status */
121#define HAL_RXERR_CRC 0x01 /* CRC error on frame */
122#define HAL_RXERR_PHY 0x02 /* PHY error, rs_phyerr is valid */
123#define HAL_RXERR_FIFO 0x04 /* fifo overrun */
124#define HAL_RXERR_DECRYPT 0x08 /* non-Michael decrypt error */
125#define HAL_RXERR_MIC 0x10 /* Michael MIC decrypt error */
126
127/* bits found in rs_flags */
128#define HAL_RX_MORE 0x01 /* more descriptors follow */
129#define HAL_RX_MORE_AGGR 0x02 /* more frames in aggr */
130#define HAL_RX_GI 0x04 /* full gi */
131#define HAL_RX_2040 0x08 /* 40 Mhz */
132#define HAL_RX_DELIM_CRC_PRE 0x10 /* crc error in delimiter pre */
133#define HAL_RX_DELIM_CRC_POST 0x20 /* crc error in delim after */
134#define HAL_RX_DECRYPT_BUSY 0x40 /* decrypt was too slow */
135#define HAL_RX_HI_RX_CHAIN 0x80 /* SM power save: hi Rx chain control */
136
137enum {
138 HAL_PHYERR_UNDERRUN = 0, /* Transmit underrun */
139 HAL_PHYERR_TIMING = 1, /* Timing error */
140 HAL_PHYERR_PARITY = 2, /* Illegal parity */
141 HAL_PHYERR_RATE = 3, /* Illegal rate */
142 HAL_PHYERR_LENGTH = 4, /* Illegal length */
143 HAL_PHYERR_RADAR = 5, /* Radar detect */
144 HAL_PHYERR_SERVICE = 6, /* Illegal service */
145 HAL_PHYERR_TOR = 7, /* Transmit override receive */
146 /* NB: these are specific to the 5212 */
147 HAL_PHYERR_OFDM_TIMING = 17, /* */
148 HAL_PHYERR_OFDM_SIGNAL_PARITY = 18, /* */
149 HAL_PHYERR_OFDM_RATE_ILLEGAL = 19, /* */
150 HAL_PHYERR_OFDM_LENGTH_ILLEGAL = 20, /* */
151 HAL_PHYERR_OFDM_POWER_DROP = 21, /* */
152 HAL_PHYERR_OFDM_SERVICE = 22, /* */
153 HAL_PHYERR_OFDM_RESTART = 23, /* */
154 HAL_PHYERR_CCK_TIMING = 25, /* */
155 HAL_PHYERR_CCK_HEADER_CRC = 26, /* */
156 HAL_PHYERR_CCK_RATE_ILLEGAL = 27, /* */
157 HAL_PHYERR_CCK_SERVICE = 30, /* */
158 HAL_PHYERR_CCK_RESTART = 31, /* */
159};
160
161/* value found in rs_keyix to mark invalid entries */
162#define HAL_RXKEYIX_INVALID ((uint8_t) -1)
163/* value used to specify no encryption key for xmit */
164#define HAL_TXKEYIX_INVALID ((u_int) -1)
165
166/* XXX rs_antenna definitions */
167
168/*
169 * Definitions for the software frame/packet descriptors used by
170 * the Atheros HAL. This definition obscures hardware-specific
171 * details from the driver. Drivers are expected to fillin the
172 * portions of a descriptor that are not opaque then use HAL calls
173 * to complete the work. Status for completed frames is returned
174 * in a device-independent format.
175 */
176#ifdef AH_SUPPORT_AR5416
177#define HAL_DESC_HW_SIZE 20
178#else
179#define HAL_DESC_HW_SIZE 4
180#endif /* AH_SUPPORT_AR5416 */
181
182struct ath_desc {
183 /*
184 * The following definitions are passed directly
185 * the hardware and managed by the HAL. Drivers
186 * should not touch those elements marked opaque.
187 */
188 uint32_t ds_link; /* phys address of next descriptor */
189 uint32_t ds_data; /* phys address of data buffer */
190 uint32_t ds_ctl0; /* opaque DMA control 0 */
191 uint32_t ds_ctl1; /* opaque DMA control 1 */
192 uint32_t ds_hw[HAL_DESC_HW_SIZE]; /* opaque h/w region */
193 union {
194 struct ath_tx_status tx;/* xmit status */
195 struct ath_rx_status rx;/* recv status */
196 } ds_us;
197};
198
199#define ds_txstat ds_us.tx
200#define ds_rxstat ds_us.rx
201
202/* flags passed to tx descriptor setup methods */
203#define HAL_TXDESC_CLRDMASK 0x0001 /* clear destination filter mask */
204#define HAL_TXDESC_NOACK 0x0002 /* don't wait for ACK */
205#define HAL_TXDESC_RTSENA 0x0004 /* enable RTS */
206#define HAL_TXDESC_CTSENA 0x0008 /* enable CTS */
207#define HAL_TXDESC_INTREQ 0x0010 /* enable per-descriptor interrupt */
208#define HAL_TXDESC_VEOL 0x0020 /* mark virtual EOL */
209/* NB: this only affects frame, not any RTS/CTS */
210#define HAL_TXDESC_DURENA 0x0040 /* enable h/w write of duration field */
211#define HAL_TXDESC_EXT_ONLY 0x0080 /* send on ext channel only (11n) */
212#define HAL_TXDESC_EXT_AND_CTL 0x0100 /* send on ext + ctl channels (11n) */
213#define HAL_TXDESC_VMF 0x0200 /* virtual more frag */
214
215/* flags passed to rx descriptor setup methods */
216#define HAL_RXDESC_INTREQ 0x0020 /* enable per-descriptor interrupt */
217#endif /* _DEV_ATH_DESC_H */
218
